headline.main: World Cup Soccer; England Hopes to Continue Mastery Over West Germany at Leon Today

byline.original: By BRIAN GLANVILLE Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: CHICAGO, June 13 Bobby Nichols shot a 67 today on the waterlogged Beverly Country Club course to take a one-shot lead in the $130,000 Western open golf tournament with a 54-hole total of 203.
docs.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO, June 13 Bobby Nichols shot a 67 today on the waterlogged Beverly Country Club course to take a one-shot lead in the $130,000 Western open golf tournament with a 54-hole total of 203.

headline.main: Nichols Shoots a 67 for 203 to Take Lead by Stroke in $130,000 Western; ROYER SLIPS TO 2D AFTER THIRD ROUND Douglass Takes Over Third, Palmer in 4-Way Tie for Fourth at Chicago

docs.snippet: Two quarterfinal round matches of the World Cup soccer championship from Mexico City will be telecast in color today at Madison Square Garden. The opening game at 2 P.M. will pair Italy and Mexico followed by Brazil and Peru.
docs.lead_paragraph: Two quarterfinal round matches of the World Cup soccer championship from Mexico City will be telecast in color today at Madison Square Garden. The opening game at 2 P.M. will pair Italy and Mexico followed by Brazil and Peru.

headline.main: Garden Screen to Show Cup Soccer Tests Today

docs.snippet: N Postman tongue-in-cheek article describes what might happen if schools were closed and students took over operation of city facilities
docs.abstract: N Postman tongue-in-cheek article describes what might happen if schools were closed and students took over operation of city facilities

headline.main: Once Upon a Time  A Fable Of Student Power

docs.snippet: BOWMANVILLE, Ontario, June 14 Dan Gurney, the new member of the McLaren racing team, picked up where the team left off last year by winning the opening Can-Am race of the 1970 season today.
docs.lead_paragraph: BOWMANVILLE, Ontario, June 14 Dan Gurney, the new member of the McLaren racing team, picked up where the team left off last year by winning the opening Can-Am race of the 1970 season today.
docs.abstract: D Gurney (McLaren M8D-Chevrolet) wins opening race in '70 Can-Amer series

headline.main: GURNEY TRIUMPHS IN CAN-AM OPENER; Hulme, His Teammate, 3d Behind Oliver in Ontario

byline.original: By JOHN S. RADOSTA Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MEXICO CITY, June 14 (UPI) West Germany and Uruguay gained overtime victories and Brazil and Italy won in regulation time today to advance to the semifinals in the World Cup soccer championships.
docs.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY, June 14 (UPI) West Germany and Uruguay gained overtime victories and Brazil and Italy won in regulation time today to advance to the semifinals in the World Cup soccer championships.

headline.main: West Germany Defeats England, 3-2, in Quarterfinals of World Cup Soccer; Soccer Moves Fans Thousands of Miles Apart to Nationalistic Fervor URUGUAY, BRAZIL, ITALY ALSO GAIN Muller's Goal in Overtime Tops Defenders Soviet, Peru and Mexico Lose

docs.snippet: MEXICO CITY, June 15 (AP) As the trainers of the World Cup soccer semifinalists were ministering to their wounded, Brazil, Italy, Uruguay and West Germany began planning their strategy for the penultimateround contests Wednesday.
docs.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY, June 15 (AP) As the trainers of the World Cup soccer semifinalists were ministering to their wounded, Brazil, Italy, Uruguay and West Germany began planning their strategy for the penultimateround contests Wednesday.

headline.main: BRAZIL REMAINS WORLD CUP CHOICE; Odds-Makers List Team at 2-1, West Germans Are 3-1

docs.snippet: The semifinals of the World Cup soccer tournament, televised via satellite from Mexico, will be shown in The Felt Forum at Madison Square Garden Center tomorrow, with the first game of the doubleheader beginning at 6 P.M.
docs.lead_paragraph: The semifinals of the World Cup soccer tournament, televised via satellite from Mexico, will be shown in The Felt Forum at Madison Square Garden Center tomorrow, with the first game of the doubleheader beginning at 6 P.M.

headline.main: World Cup Soccer TV At Forum Tomorrow
